titleStmt.title: A Collection of Arabic Dialect Texts
titleStmt.author: Stephan Procházka
Charly Moerth

sourceDesc.p: This is an original digital text
This is an original digital text

particDesc.p: This text was recorded during a fieldwork campaign in Cilicia in February 1998. The speaker is a then-fifty-year-old Alawi woman from the village of Kazanlı situated about 15 km east of the provincial capital Mersin and 30 km west of Tarsus.

div.u: The Seven Brothers, they were in former times; of course, we do not (really) know it, but they tell (the story) like this. We know it (only) how they tell it.

These Seven Brothers were living in Pharaoh’s time and they say that the Pharaoh was in Tarsus. The Pharaoh was very much cursed, a tyrant, a tyrant who was very much cursed. And those Seven Brothers, they… I do not know all their names.

It is said that they were the sons of his sister, the sons of his sister, that means the Pharaoh was their maternal uncle. Yes, he was such a tyrant that he made even drudge the sons of his sister, he subjugated them and let them starve. It is said that he even did not allow them to rest. After he had them let work again and again, they said: “Hey, let us rest a little, just a little bit!”

They went to a place where they could rest, where they could sleep, (because) when he would see them he would beat them. So they fled from him and went towards the mountains and it is said that they saw a shepherd, a herdsman. This shepherd said to them: “Where do you go?” – They said: “By God, we would like to rest, we want to flee a while from the Pharaoh.”

He said: “Take me with you!” – They said: “Okay, let’s go!” – They took him and he had a dog with him, (called) Qaṭmīr. They kept on going with him and then they reached the mountain, a cave, a cave which they entered.
In it was a hole and they entered it saying: “If we enter this place the Pharaoh will not see us.” So they all went down: the dog, the shepherd, and the Seven Brothers – and they fell asleep.

They had been sleeping for 309 years, 309 years. When they woke up they said: “We are hungry, let us eat!” – They said to one of their brothers: “O brother, go and bring us some bread, bring us bread and supplies: olives, cheese… whatever there is to eat, we are hungry”.

They had some coins with them and so this man went to the shop and said to him (i.e. the shopkeeper): “My brother, give me some bread and give me cheese and olives, so that we can eat (it)!” – He looked at the money (but) they had not such a money any longer.

He said to him: “You have me on! What kind of money is this?” – He said to him: “By God, this is (real) money!” – Then this (man) said: “We do not use such money here!” – He said to him: “How come, we have been sleeping for an hour and in that very hour the money has changed?”

These Seven Brothers thought that they had been sleeping only for an hour or two, (but now) it was said to him: “By God, my brother, it’s not like that!” – He (the shopkeeper) said: “Hey, wait here, I’ll come back!” – He went to inform the police: “This money was brought by that man there who wants bread for it. Just come and (let me know) from when and from where it is, what kind of money it is!”

He (the policeman) checked it and said: “This is from Pharaoh’s time, this money is from the time of the Pharaoh.” – They looked and said to him: “When did you fall asleep?” – He looked around and (recognized) that the world has changed completely, that the neighborhood has changed and that he did not know where to go.

However, he had found the shop but now they came in and asked him: “Where did you sleep?” – He said: “We slept in the cave.” – They said: “Come on, show us your brothers!” – They took him and went over there, then they said to him: “Go on, bring your brothers out that we can talk to them!”

They had woken up by themselves… and (then) he (the policeman) said to him: “309 years, 309 years ago this money was used, but now there is no money like that, a long time has passed (since then).” He said: “Go inside and bring your brothers! Come up here that we can talk a little!”

He looked around, entered the place of his brothers and said to them: “My brothers, we haven’t slept for one or two hours only. We have slept for 309 years.” They said: “What should we do now? That means if we weren’t good people for God, he had not let us sleep like that. We must try not to go out again.”

What should they do? They started to pray to their Lord saying: “O Lord, don’t embarrass us in front of your servants, and make us not to go out again!” These… God, I take refuge to him, He turned the dog Qaṭmīr into a stone, and He turned the camel into a stone, but as for the Seven Brothers and the shepherd – we don’t know it for sure, but according to the legend – He raised them into the sky and turned them into stars in the sky.

They have become stars in the sky and now (this constellation) is like a coffee pot, like the coffee pot we use to make coffee with. Yes, He took them and (made them) a constellation like this which remains on the sky. After the night has come, it will raise and they say they (i.e. its stars) are the Seven Brothers.

It is said that they use to come down every day to the place where they had been sleeping and then they called them the “People of the Cave”, “the People of the Cave”. Those who had been sleeping in their cave, sleeping in it, they called them the “People of the Cave”.

These are the Seven Brothers. The place where the Seven Brothers slept is over there. Every day, towards the morning, towards the morning, very early, they come down and visit that place to go up (to the sky) again. So they say but we do not know it (exactly).

However, once on a summer day I was sleeping on the roof and when I woke up I saw (them), really or not, I saw them in the direction of (the place called) the People of the Cave, there they came down. I do not really know how, because it is far away, so I do not know. I saw them like this, coming down from that side, but then the morning came and it began to dawn. So I do not know how it really happened.

But they say it’s like that, so they say it. They go up to the sky every day and next to them… the constellation is like a coffee pot. There are the Seven Brothers and in the middle is the shepherd: a small spot situated next to them. If you stay until night I’ll show it to you. So they say but I don’t know it for sure.

After they had woke up, this one brother of them entered to bring them out. He said to them (i.e. the people who were waiting outside): “I will persuade them and bring them out. As for you, don’t enter (the cave) after me!” – After he had entered they began to pray to their Lord.

They went up to the sky while the police and the soldiers and the (other) men were waiting outside. The waited and waited but nobody came out. When there was nobody coming out they said to themselves: “Let us enter to look for them!” They entered and they saw a camel turned into stone and they saw a dog turned into a stone. They looked around, but in the cave there was nothing else.

Inside the cave there are many doors, they looked around but they could not go inside, it was dark, so they were not able to go further inside. They searched and searched but they found nothing. So the soldiers and the police returned, they returned not having seen anything.

There are also people who maintain that there is an underground way from that cave that leads to the hajj (i.e. to Mecca). That we (only) heard, but I don’t know. When we were young we often went down into those caves. Inside the big cave there are still many (smaller) caves.
But one cannot enter them, it’s dark, one does not know how to enter and to come out again, one cannot dare it. However, they say there is a way from there to the hajj, under the ground.

Now they’ve filled it up; a boy got lost there, a boy of thirteen or fourteen got lost there. He entered the cave and could not come out, he did not know where to come out. Then soldiers and the police came and looked for him, but they did not see him. Therefore they closed those caves, they closed them in order not to worry about (people who get lost there). That’s the story.

particDesc.p: This text was recorded in Morocoo.

revisionDesc.change: add notebook evaluation of the library

div.u: A: Ich und der Schakal, mit dem ich zu tun hatte.
Der Schakal mit dem ich zu tun hatte, das war eine Geschichte.
A: Diese Geschichte, die sich abspielte, du wirst erstaunt sein.
Diese Geschichte die sich da abspielte.
Als er und ich miteinander zu tun hatten.
A: Der Schakal, ér riss uns die Schafe.
So ein Herr hatte einen Gaul.
B: Ja ich kenne das Wort Gaul.
A: Er graste und fiel dann einen Felssturz einfach so hinunter,
fiel runter und starb. Dieser Gaul.
A: Dieser Schakal, wird er jetzt diesen abgestürzten Kadaver,
also den Gaul essen. Es bestand kein Zweifel, dass er kommen und davon essen würde.
A: Und was sagte ich dazu?
Ich werde diesen Schakal mit diesem Essen, das er dort essen wird, fangen.
31 A: Also, mein Herr ich ging los.
dass es so Falle (Fallen) gäbe, die wenn jemand darauf drückt sich sofort schließen.
Wenn sie so zu dem Gaul hin getan würde.
Ich legte ein Schlinge damit er (der Schakal) in diese Schlinge stieg und in sie hineinkroch und damit er dann hochgezogen würde.
A: Ja, also kurz gesagt ich nahm Falle.
Ich stellte so drei Fallen auf.
Es war so gegen vier Uhr.
Er kam näher und immer näher.
Ich war versteckt und er konnte mich nicht sehen, ich war ja versteckt.
Und er kam bis zu so einer Falle.
Er hat ihren Geruch gewittert und ging weiter seines Weges.
Der wird am Abend kommen, in der Dunkelheit der Nacht wenn es dunkel ist.
In der Früh kam ich also.
Ich fand die Fallen so vor.
Dieser Hurensohn hat den Geruch gewittert,
Da sagte ich ihm, dass er und ich eine Geschichte haben würden.
B: Ja, das Wort Vieh kenne ich.
A: Das Vieh ging also vorbei
Ich ging nicht auf dem Weg
aber ich ließ sie so gehen um ihn anzulocken
Ich legte den Stein so, dass nur mehr einer durchkommen würde der zu dieser Zeit vorbeikommen würde.
Ich saß eine Zeit als er kam als er kam und sein Weibchen mitbrachte.
Wir sagen, dass er eine Frau hat.
Seine Frau, die er sich genommen hat.
Kennst du die weiblichen Genitalien? Die von Sohn kennst du nicht.
C: Lulu wie heißt das noch einmal sein Weibchen.
Der Hund, die Hündin, der Esel, die Eselin.
um mit ihr zu spielen, er folgte ihr,
Also diese Rebhühner, ich jage sie.
Er und ich wir sahen das Rebhuhn fliegen.
Er folgte dem Geruch des toten Gaules.
Sie ging auch um zu essen.
Da wo sie hinstieg stieg er auch hin.
Sie kam an diesem Kadaver vorbei kam aber nicht zur Falle.
kam zu so einem Stein und setzte sich.
Er sprang auf ihn hinauf und setzte sich hin.
Er hörte sie die Knochen kauen und
sprang vom Stein herunter und ging.
Er sah die Falle so wie gestern
A: Er trat den Rückzug an.
Er wußte nicht was tun, vielleicht legte er sich wieder dorthin nieder
Ein wenig später er kam zurück.
Er kam bis vor diese Falle zurück, blieb und schaute sie an.
Langsam, ganz langsam machte er das.
A: ...und schon hatte sie ihn gefangen.
Er hatte sich geirrt. Er biss in das Eisen.
C: Sie ließ ihn nicht entkommen?
A: Ja, diesmal blieb ich und schaute ihn mir an.
Er verbiss sich in der Falle.
dass die Falle aus Eisen in ihn geschnitten hatte.
Das Eisen drang in sein Fleisch ein,
Dieses Fleisch war gefangen, denn die Eiserne hielt ihn fest gefangen.
Dass es so war fand er heraus,
als dieses Eisen ihn ihm stecken blieb
und sich in sein Fleisch hineinfraß.
und ich gab ihm noch eines drauf
Er ging auf mich los, um mich zu beißen
aber ich schlug ihn mit der Peitsche.
Da sagte ich zu ihm: schau dir
Du bist der, der schlau ist.
Aber das war nicht sehr schlau von dir.
